Reviews.Title: “Stay in Venice”
Reviews.Author: herb a
Reviews.Content: Room is awsome. The view is incrediable it truly is what they have on their web site. There our tourist taking pictures of the building we are in. <bathroom and <bedrooms very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Place”
Reviews.Author: wkbrdjeff
Reviews.Content: Pleasantly, pleasantly surprised. Amazing view, amazing room with a lot of charm, clean, walking distance to everything. Highly reccomended. Great staff, friendly. First time visiting and would reccomend to everyone. We met a couple in the lobby who came here on a reccomedation from a friend also.

Reviews.Title: “The best view of Venice”
Reviews.Author: Yar_VT
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel with great views! Hotel Name support real exciting views of the Piazza San Marco and the bay! Excellent staff who meets a friendly and service. Every morning you wake up and look out the window, where you see the main dostoprimichatelnost Venice, Piazza San Marco, watching as the city starts to wake up, as tourists pervade the area! Elegant rooms, fully equipped and comfortable on the location. Romantic and demanding. Perhaps because of this hotel you will discover the best views of Venice!

Reviews.Title: “Really Best Windows”
Reviews.Author: LeandroSJ
Reviews.Content: Best Windows Venice is a brilliant place to stay in Venice. The window view is amazing! Can you imagine be located at St. Marks Square? So, I was there! Perfect place for couples, very romantic atmosphere. The room has everything you need and the Wii fi was very good. Best Windows Venice Ã© um lugar incrÃ­vel para ficar em Veneza. A vista Ã© perfeita! Imagine ficar no meio da PraÃ§a de SÃ£o Marcos! O lugar Ã© muito bom para casais, o quarto Ã© bem romantico. O quarto tambÃ©m Ã© muito bem equipado, tem tudo o que se precisa. O wii-fi tinha Ã³timo sinal no quarto.

Reviews.Title: “The best view in venice”
Reviews.Author: kirstysnow
Reviews.Content: We treated ourselves to one night in this room for our anniversary and loved it, felt like a princess watching the crowds below the balcony. Thanks to the staff at the hotel panada who sorted my error when i booked the wrong date by mistake. I am so glad we stayed here and would definately recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable Location in the most Amazing City in the World!”
Reviews.Author: Moreta57
Reviews.Content: We splurged for this room for our first night in Venice. It was splendid! Instead of milling around in the heat and crowds, we simply sat in our gorgeous air-conditioned room, ate some yummy fruit from the basket, sipped some wine and gazed out the window right at St Mark's. After dinner we came back, threw the windows open and listened to the dueling orchestras and enjoyed a moonlit view of the plaza and basilica. In the morning we simply popped downstairs to enjoy the piazza before the crowds returned. AND to get a picture ofourselves standing at the window in the famous clock tower. An unforgettable first day & night in Venice. Go to Italy at your first opportunity and stay at least one night here when you visti Venice!

Reviews.Title: “Great room and location”
Reviews.Author: 270Shafer
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our 1 night stay in Venice at the Best Windows Hotel. I was looking for a suite with classic Venice decor and a view of some sort. The pictures on the web site are completely accurate. And you can't beat the view of Piazza San Marco and all the people watching. Very close to the San Marco Vaparetto stop. You actually check in to the Hotel Panda, a few minutes walk. But be sure to ask for a map to the Hotel Panda or google directions before your trip. Fortunately, we had a GPS with us and were able to find the find the "check-in" hotel that way. The people at the Hotel Panda were very friendly and helpful. The manager walked us over to the Best Windows. Shortly after arrival I inadvertently locked the safe without entering a new passcode. The Hotel Panda sent someone over within 15 minutes to get the safe open. If we go to Venice again, this is the place we would stay.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning View, Large Room, Great Service”
Reviews.Author: maxriv74
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed there for 3 nights in early July. Arrival can be a bit challenging, as the reception dest is about 2 tiny blocks away, but once there they will gladly help you with your luggage back to your room. This was my second time to Venice and by Venetian standards, the room was not only large, but also extremely clean. The scaffolding that some of the reviewers mentioned had been removed the day we arrived. The view was spectacular, and remarkably quiet considering you are in the main plaza. You do hear the bell tower, but I'm not sure you can avoid that as it does ring across much of the area in San Marco. We got to stay for one of their annual fireworks regattas' which we enjoyed directly from our room's window. We avoided the thousands of tourists down below, and instead just pulled up a chair to the open window, drank champagne, ate mini paninis and enjoyed the show. Alex at the front desk was absolutely amazing. He tended to all our needs and made sure our stay was nothing less than incredible. I will include Germany on my next trip my friend. Thank you very much. Venice Tip: 1) Keep an open mind, You will not find contemporary W Hotels in Venice. It can come across as dirty and overly classic for many tourists. This is part of the old world charm and should be appreciated in such a way. It can be completely surreal. Venice transcends you back to a time were life was simpler yet more difficult and quieter yet louder all at the same time. Cherish it for what it will become to you. Although, it wouldn't hurt to see Venice have 30-40 guys around the city picking up trash. Venice Tip: 2) We loved Venice for all it's beauty. It's a city that will stay with you forever, but arriving and departing into the city is something I'd budget for the next time I go. The public water Taxi is inexpensive, but when you're carrying around your luggage and just want to arrive or leave Venice, it can be absolute hell waiting for the dozen stops and distances you have to commute before your bags are stowed. Save a few bucks and take a semi private or private boat to get you near the hotel and bus terminal fast.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful dream!”
Reviews.Author: Max-Max-44
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I have booked the room with the view on St. Mark's Square. The room was a fairy tale and was also very clean, the forniture was adorable and accurate. The location was perfect, in fact the view was on one of the most beautiful places in the world. The staff was great and helpful, and we felt like in a dream. We absolutely recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “We loved it”
Reviews.Author: dona1412
Reviews.Content: It just offered everything it promised. We loved the view and felt privileged to be staying in that particular house at the famous location. You can practically touch the copies of the famous horses on the Basilica St.Marco which are at one level with the room window. Even when it rained, we could open the window, hear the music from the cafes on the square and enjoy our wine. It would have been perfect to have had a coffee/tea kettle for the early morning coffee/tea we are used to. It was our 3rd visit to Venice and we were not stressed for seeing as much as possible in a very short time. The mood was romantic and the room was a perfect frame to it.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible view and location”
Reviews.Author: MeeksinMemphis
Reviews.Content: This room is at an absolutely amazing location - the clock tower in San Marco Piazza, with the most incredible view! Check-in was a short couple of blocks away and the staff were extremely friendly and helpful and always available. In the evenings the sounds of the bands playing at the cafes drifted into our room (when the windows were open), which was like having our own mini symphony playing outside our window. The hourly ringing of the clock was not an issue for us during the night as we always sleep with earplugs, and the sounds of the people in the piazza was entirely insulated when the windows were closed, although we enjoyed having the windows open most of the time. The room was a very generous size and elegantly decorated, and we actually enjoyed NOT being in an actual hotel. We were afraid that the pictures and recommendations were too good to be true, but they were not. I cannot say enough to recommend this place - we loved it!!!

Reviews.Title: “I Felt Like a Queen”
Reviews.Author: pamfoto
Reviews.Content: Venice is a gem of Italy, and staying at Best Windows heightened my experience. As I entererd the room, it was everything I hoped it would be in terms of beauty,size and location. I felt like a queen upon opening the two large windows to view hundreds who were enjoying the sights below in the Piazza San Marco. At night, live music filtered in from talented musicians perfoming in the cafes. The Basilica and Doge's Palace glistened with romantic light adding to the ambiance. Best Windows is not the typical hotel in terms of layout and service. Check in and keys must be secured at the Antico Panada, an affiliate hotel a short distance away. Any requests I had were attended to immediately by the Panada's cordial staff. Do keep in mind that this room comes with a hefty price tag and one needs to access whether the noise from the clock tower next to the rooms is going to be bothersome, especially during the evening. For me, the positive aspects far outweighted the negatives. A stay at Best Windows was truly a unique and magical experience. I never wanted to leave.

Reviews.Title: “great view”
Reviews.Author: ftalib
Reviews.Content: Great location and perhaps the best view of San Marco. overall staff very cooperative. Rooms with no frills but good design and very comfortable. would be very happy to stay at best windows on my next venice visit. However the attitude of Max (forgot full name) at the reception was very non cooperative and argumentative. it left a bad taste for us and we would not like to visit the hotel in his presence

Reviews.Title: “Best of Venice right outside your window!”
Reviews.Author: BostonRalph
Reviews.Content: We could not have been happier with this room. This was the 3rd stop on our honeymoon and the room and view were spectacular! This room is in the watchtower overlooking the Basilica and S. Marco Sq. Check-in is handled at the very friendly Hotel Panada just around the corner. Upon check-in we met Alex at the front desk. His absolute kindness and eagerness to help is unmatched! We were a bit concerned about whether or not it would be noisy being right on the square. The windows are of excellent quality and we had no issues at all. We look forward to our return.

Reviews.Title: “Yes, perhaps this is the best view of the square of San Marco!”
Reviews.Author: AndreyKazarin
Reviews.Content: I wanted to show friends the city. I was looking for hotel overlooking Piazza San Marko. Accidentally discovered in late booking.com list the name of Best Windows Hotel. I called them and learned that this new rooms in the building ClockTower. Arriving at the place I am happy to discover that the photos on the site of the hotel fully correspond to reality! You get a view of Basilica di San Marco, Palazzo Ducale, dock for gondolas, view of the very square, excellent columns, Venetian flags, amazing lights of pink glass, all that we see on postcards... In the morning, waking up in a hotel room, made a modernized Venetian classic style, you receive 90% of all those types of cities, for which you are coming here. The rooms I would describe as a quiet respectable. Tasteful, without unnecessary frills. See Web Site. I think, that in another time with pleasure staying at the Best Windows Hotel I wish you all successful trips to Italy. Sincerely, Andrey Kazarin

Reviews.Title: “Best Window..Best place to stay!!”
Reviews.Author: maureenSunshineCoast
Reviews.Content: Arriving in Venice in anticipation of a wonderful stay in a unique place in the world , we were absolutely thrilled and delighted with our accommadation in the "Best Windows" chain of hotels.. The location is priceless, open your window and look below over the famous Saint Marco's Square... out to the Grand Canal..how grand!! One can open the windows for the music wafting up from the plaza bands and the muted clock chimes or close the world out and be in your own little royal palace. The room and it's furnishings are five star, the richness and class of fabrics, decor and amenities are superb. Complete with a jacuzzi to pamper your weary body after strolling the many lanes of Venice.. Feeling secure in a strange city is also a priority for the hotel.. nothing has been overlooked for your comfort and pleasure while you stay in "Best Windows" suite.. Thanks.. see you next time 10/10

HotelInfo.Name: Best Windows
HotelInfo.Address: San Marco 144, 30124 Venice, Italy
